name: Tabber
description: A jQuery plugin for adding simple tabbed interfaces.

options.name: maxWidth
options.description: Width at which to auto-disable mobile styles

options.name: vertical
options.description: Flag to draw vertical tab set

demo_resources:
<!--[DEMO:START-RESOURCES]-->

		<style>
			.demo .tabbed .tabber-handle { font-size: 16px; line-height: 40px; margin: 0 1px 0 0; padding: 0 20px; }
			.demo .tabbed .tabber-handle.active { background: #eee; }

			.demo .tabbed .tabber-tab { background: #eee; padding: 20px; }
			.demo .tabbed .tabber-tab p { margin: 10px 0; }

			.demo .tabbed.mobile .tabber-tab { padding-top: 10px; }
			.demo .tabbed.mobile .tabber-tab p { margin-top: 0; }
		</style>

		<script>
			$(document).ready(function() {
				$(".demo .tabbed").tabber();

				$(window).one("pronto.load", function() {
					$(".demo .tabbed").tabber("destroy");
				});
			});
		</script>
demo_content:
Basic

Target tabbed interfaces should match the following markup pattern:


<div class="tabbed">
	<menu class="tabber-menu">
		<a href="#tab-1" class="tabber-handle">Tab 1</a>
		<a href="#tab-2" class="tabber-handle">Tab 2</a>
		<a href="#tab-3" class="tabber-handle">Tab 3</a>
	</menu>
	<div class="tabber-tab" id="tab-1">
		Content...
	</div>
	<div class="tabber-tab" id="tab-2">
		Content...
	</div>
	<div class="tabber-tab" id="tab-3">
		Content...
	</div>
</div>
			
$(".tabbed").tabber();
Demo
Tab 1 Tab 2 Tab 3

Breakpoint

By default, Tabber will enable itself on screens smaller then 980 pixels wide. You can specify a different width by setting the maxWidth option on initialization.

$(".tabbed").tabber({ maxWidth: "740px" });

Erat a ante venenatis dapibus posuere velit aliquet. Praesent commodo cursus magna, vel scelerisque nisl consectetur et. Donec ullamcorper nulla non metus auctor fringilla.


Vertical

You can also create a vertical tab set:

$(".tabbed").tabber({
	vertical: true
});

IE Support

When supporting IE you will need to include a HTML5 enabler and matchMedia polyfill (IE 8, IE 9).
